--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Mike Morris" <mikro2nd@...> wrote:
>
> ...or=
 am I not understanding something?
> 
> Tried @Ignoring an @BeforeClass met=
hod, but it doesn't get ignored. 
> Bug in the runner or in my understandin=
g?
>

Maybe it is a bug, But I think it is your understanding is wrong.
@Be=
foreClass is like the junit3 TestSetup class.
@Before is like setUp
you sho=
uld use @Ignoring to a @Test annotation.
In eclipse when you use @Ignoring =
to a @Test,the runner show 
a slash icon before the test.
